page.title: 09Bat and Ball Railway Station
page.content: Bat and Ball Station is at the bottom of St. Johns Hill Sevenoaks. On the 3rd of July we went there on an outing. When we got to the station we saw a sign saying closed on Sundays. Then we went through a gate to look for the guard but we couldn't find him. We went there again and this time he was there. He showed us an overgrown turn table used many years ago. The station was built in 1865 approximately. It had a goods yard and trains used to stop there to be refilled with water. On the front of the station there was a ring to tie a pony and cart up with. Across the road from the station there are houses where the people who worked at the station used to live. Now they are council houses. On a weekday the station is closed from 11.00 until 15.00. It has a very big waiting room and free parking.
